info.title: Laboperator API
info.description:
This is the Laboperator API documentation bundled with
your Laboperator Server. It will reflect the API v2 subversion that
runs on this instance.

# PRE-RELEASE
The current distribution of the API v2 is a pre-realease and as such
subject to frequent updates and potentially breaking changes.

# Changlelog
This changelog will be kept here for pre-releases only.

## v2.0.0-rc.12
### Added
- introduce trait-tags in API V2 documentaion for common query parameters `fields`, `filter`, `sort`, `page`

### Change
- API V2 data_points endpoints are normalized

## v2.0.0-rc.11

### Added
- additional endpoints for `jobs`, `views`, `tasks`, `notifications`, `ports`, `schemas`
- custom rake task `rake spec:api_v2_docs` for running specs along with generation of documentation
- `filter` fetch parameter accepts and understands comparison operators `gt`, `ge`, `lt`, `le`, `eq`, `ne`, `lk`, `nlk`

### Changed
- invalid query params are not ignored anymore but throw a 'Bad Request' error

### Fixed
- ActiveRecord validation errors are handled by JsonApiUtils
- `fields` specs context and descriptions
- errors which happen on a middleware level are handled in a JsonApiUtils manner

## v2.0.0-rc.10

### Changed
- invalid query params are not ignored anymore but throw a 'Bad Request' error

### Fixed
- ActiveRecord validation errors are handled by JsonApiUtils

## v2.0.0-rc.9

### Changed
- updated schema structure

### Fixed
- missing id parameter for device command endpoint
- minor errors in several response and body schemas

## v2.0.0-rc.8

### Added
- command execution endpoints
- devices command endpoint

## v2.0.0-rc.7

### Added
- protocol rule endpoints

## v2.0.0-rc.6

### Added
- data points endpoints
- task include `result`
- measurement `data_points` documentation
- measurement `protocol_entries` documentation

### Fixed
- task type serialization

## v2.0.0-rc.5

### Added
- support for filters
- support for sparse field sets
- Task.parameters documentation
- custom attributes documentation
- Job.response
- Task include option for Measurements
- added `created_at`, `description`, `end_at`, `protocol_entries`, `start_at`, `status`, `updated_at`, `uuid` to Measurement serializer

### Fixed
- URLs in links for subtyped entities

### Removed
- create action for channels
- `prev` and `next` links without logical relation (most cases as of now)

# Standards
The API uses standards (referenced below) and best practices to
make the interaction as easy as possible. Not only are standards
a great way of benefitting from the collective experience of a large
community that develops these standards, but also for users to rely
on a vivid ecosystem of documentation and resources.

## OpenAPI specification
This API is documented in the both human- and machine-readable
[OpenAPI](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification) format.
You can download the raw OpenAPI document for this API using the
button on the top of this page.

The OpenAPI specification originates from the
[swagger.io](https://swagger.io). There is an active community
around the standard and many [tools](https://openapi.tools)
available for most modern programming environments.

## JSON:API specification
While OpenAPI specifies how to document an API,
[JSON:API](https://jsonapi.org) is a specification for building APIs in
[JSON](https://www.json.org). It is mostly a set of conventions that help
us to build a consistent service. Our developers and users of the API
alike can build on generalized tooling and a common understanding of
what to expect.

oauth2.description:
All requests against the API need to be authenticated. We use
[OAuth 2.0](https://oauth.net/2/) to implement different
authentication strategies. If you are not familiar with OAuth,
yet, you can get started with some
[useful resources](https://oauth.net/articles/) to understand the
basics. All OAuth strategies lead to an Access Token being issued
that needs to be included in the headers of any API request.

For example:
```
Authorization: Bearer 6e5ca31a16a1bf3426b33ace25efd07d03afb1c63e5f5c0fb6e82ef8b0293a0d
```

### Prerequisites
Every third-party code that wants to authenticate against the API
needs to be registered as an OAuth Client or in the Laboperator
terminology an Application.

Read more about [how to create an Application](https://support.labforward.io/support/solutions/articles/19000106654-how-to-create-a-new-oauth-client-application)
from your Laboperator admin account.

### OAuth Authorization Flows
The Laboperator API supports the following OAuth 2 authorization flows:

  - [Authorization Code](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-22#section-4.1)
  - [Client Credentials](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-22#section-4.4)
  - [Resource Owner Password](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-22#section-4.3)

Both `Authorization Code` and `Resource Owner Password` will authorize requests as the Resource Owner,
while `Client Credentials` flow, will authorize requests as the Application Owner.

More information on the procedure can be found in the
[Authentication article](https://support.labforward.io/support/solutions/articles/19000106856-authentication) in the helpdesk.

url.description: A post request will dispatched to this url.

headers.description: Any headers that should be added to the request.

type.description:
The type of trigger to signal. As of now only `manual` triggers
are allowed to be signaled via API.

substep.description: Index of the substep that gives context to this trigger.

key.description:
A key that identifies the manual trigger in the context of the
step. When definind a behavior the key is passed as an option to
the manual trigger definition. The same key can be passed to a
button on a substep. When the button is clicked this key is
passed with the trigger. The key allows to use multiple manual
trigger in the context of the same step or substep.

parameters.description:
Any parameters send with the command including the command
that was triggered itself.

status.description:
There are four well defined status values:

- **sent:** The command was send to the device
- **confirmed:** The command was received by the device and will be processed
- **success:** The command has successfully been processed
- **error:** An error has occured whil processing the command

Additionally there might be other status values the device
sends after confirming the command and before finishing or
failing.

data.description:
Any update or result data the device sends back. The
content of this attribute depends on the device type and
the command.

oneOf.description:
For the sake of efficiency the DataPoint entity is not a Resource Object as per the JSON:API specification.

A DataPoint is instead provided as a quadruple Array of `channel_id`, `timestamp`, `value` and `str_value`.

The `channel_id` and the `timestamp` uniquely identify any data point.

Either `value` and `str_value` will always be `null` depending on the channel type.

**Note:** The order of the items is always as mentioned above,
which can due to limitations of the OpenApi specification not be expressed correctly in the schema.

get.description: Download a previously uploaded workflow template file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of WorkflowStepTemplate with a file to download.

WorkflowStepTemplate download.value:
---
schema_version: '0.0.1' # version of the workflow template schema
info:
  version: '1.0.0'
  uuid: b16e8146-d14e-4052-8ad8-0fd6d53d9ed0 # can be passed an external uuid
  title: A Great Step
  description: |
    Add a fancy description here. It even supports __Markdown__!
  author:
    name: Max Mustermann
    email: max.mustermann@company.com
  slug: a-great-step

fields:
  sample: # basic types
    type: string
    maxLength: 100
  powderDispenser: # relationships
    type: relationship
    resourceType: devices
    prepare: true # required before starting the workflow

substeps:
  - primary: Load a {{sample}} into the {{powderDispenser}}.
    secondary: Please, confirm when you are done.
    confirm: true
    timer:
      type: timer
      defaultDuration: 5s

  - primary: |
      The sample will be gravimetrically placed in a {{target}} reaction tube.
    devices:
      - powderDispenser
    behaviors:
      - title: Start gravimetrical measurement
        when: ON_SUBSTEP_START
        do:
          - SEND_COMMAND:
              device: powderDose
              command: GET_GRAVIMETRICAL_MEASUREMENT
              scope: substep # could be step or even workflow run?!

  - primary: |
      Results after gravimetrical placement are recorded: {{actual}}
    behaviors:
      - when: ON_SUBSTEP_START
        delay: 4s
        do:
          - ALERT:
              title: Finished!
              text: We are done here.
          - COMPLETE_SUBSTEP
          - COMPLETE_STEP

  - primary: Send results to ELN
    behaviors:
      - when: ON_SUBSTEP_COMPLETE
        do:
          - webhook:
              url: https://my_endpoint.com/webhook
              method: post
              blocking: true
              headers:
                content-type: application/json
              body: body_value
              onSuccess:
                processor: json
                do:
                  - SET_FIELD:
                      field: actual
                      value: data.value
              onError:
                processor: json
                do:
                  - REPEAT_SUBSTEP
              onCode:
                '404':
                  processor: json
                  do:
                    - ALERT:
                        title: Not Found
                        text: Ensure that you're using a valid
                          url / endpoint

                '418':
                  processor: json
                  do:
                    - ALERT:
                        title: I'm a teapot
                        text: For real! I'm a teapot

WorkflowTemplate download.value:
---
schema_version: '0.0.1' # version of the workflow template schema
info:
  version: '1.0.0' # version of the workflow
  uuid: 848b05e2-7e86-4f9d-9067-825c3597ec28 # can be passed an external uuid
  title: My Premium Workflow
  description: |
    Add a fancy description here. It even supports __Markdown__!
  author:
    name: Max Mustermann
    email: max.mustermann@company.com
  slug: my-premium-workflow
config:
  contextInfoSettings:
    toggleButton:
      label: Overflowing Context Toggle Button
    contentPanel:
      color: '#002b56'
      height: 140
  reportHeader: 'Experiment {{run.data.attributes.title}}'
contextInfo:
  pages: # these pages will be displayed throughout the entire workflow run
    - title: Global Info
      content: |
        *Once, if my memory serves me well, my life was a banquet where every heart revealed itself, where every wine flowed.* â Arthur Rimbaud

fields:
  someString: # basic types
    type: string
    maxLength: 100
    defaultValue: 'Test'
  balance: # relationships
    type: relationship
    resourceType: devices
    prepare: true # required before starting the workflow
  instrumentInstructions: # files
    type: file
    mediaType: application/my-instruments-config-file-type
    prepare: true
    readOnly: true # can not be changed once the workflow is started
    output: false # should not be part of a the workflows export output
  actualWeight: # quantities
    type: quantity
    unit: mg
  actualVolume:
    type: quantity
    unit: ml
  density: # scripts
    type: script
    script: actualWeight / actualVolume
    readOnly: true # script fields are required to be read-only
    result:
      type: quantity
      unit: mg
  selectorResult:
    type: string
    hidden: true
    maxLength: 100

steps:
  weighing: # within the workflow this needs to be a unique reference
    info:
      title: Weighing

    contextInfo: # these pages will be displayed only for this step
      pages:
        - title: Really Long Weighing Info Page Title
          content: |
            *One chord is fine. Two chords is pushing it. Three chords and you're into jazz.* â Lou Reed

            ![music](https://source.unsplash.com/600x400/?music)

    fields:
      sample:
        type: relationship
        resourceType: samples
      target:
        type: quantity
        unit: mg
      actual:
        type: quantity
        unit: mg

    substeps:
      - primary: Place the {{sample}} on the balance.
        description: |
          Your fancy markdown body with formatting, images and what not else!
        confirm: true
        timer:
          type: timer
          defaultDuration: 5s
      - primary: Selector
        confirm: true
        selector:
          layout: list
          result: selectorResult
          title: 'Treats'
          description: |
            You nailed that first substep. You deserve to treat yourself. Choose ~~one~~ **multiple** options!
          multiSelection: true
          skipBehaviors: false
          options:
            - primary: 'Red Hawk Cheese'
              secondary: |
                Red Hawk is a type of American triple-crÃ¨me aged cow's-milk cheese with a brine-washed rind produced by the Cowgirl Creamery in Point Reyes Station, California.
              thumbnail: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Cowgirl_Creamery_Point_Reyes_-_Red_Hawk_cheese.jpg/320px-Cowgirl_Creamery_Point_Reyes_-_Red_Hawk_cheese.jpg
              value: 'cheese'
            - primary: 'Red Wine'
              secondary: |
                Wine comes in at the mouth. And love comes in at the eye; Thatâs all we shall know for truth, before we grow old and die.
              thumbnail: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Tempranillowine.jpg/320px-Tempranillowine.jpg
              value: 'wine'
            - primary: 'Espresso'
              secondary: |
                The size can be a single, double, or triple, using a proportional amount of ground coffee, roughly 7, 14, and 21 grams; correspondingly sized filter baskets are used.
              thumbnail: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Doppio.jpg/320px-Doppio.jpg
              value: 'espresso'
    reportSummary: "{{template.steps.weighing.info.title}}: This is the information that will be generated by this step, when it's completed, in the report. We have a field reference here: {{someString}}. Completed by {{operator.data.attributes.full_name}}"

  dosing:
    uuid: b3fc8c2b-aa03-4ab7-9172-377ef38fd860
    version: 1.0.0

  stirring:
    info:
      title: Stirring
    contextInfo:
      pages:
        - title: Dosing Info
          content: |
            *I like to occasionally write an infinite loop to remind my computer who's boss.* â Ben Awad
    reportSummary: This is the report for the stirring step.

    substeps:
      - primary: The wheel on the bus goes round and round

  externalStep:
    info:
      title: A Great Step
      description: |
        Add a fancy description here. It even supports __Markdown__!
      author:
        name: Max Mustermann
        email: max.mustermann@company.com
      slug: a-great-step

    behaviors:
      - when: ON_SUBSTEP_START
        do:
          notify:
            text: 'Starting substep of externalStep'
            variant: info
            autoHideDuration: 50

    fields:
      sample: # basic types
        type: string
        maxLength: 100
      powderDispenser: # relationships
        type: relationship
        resourceType: devices
        prepare: true # required before starting the workflow

    substeps:
      - primary: Load a {{sample}} into the {{powderDispenser}}.
        secondary: Please, confirm when you are done.
        confirm: true

      - primary: |
          The sample will be gravimetrically placed in a {{target}} reaction tube.
        devices:
          - powderDispenser
        behaviors:
          - title: Start gravimetrical measurement
            when: ON_SUBSTEP_START
            do:
              - SEND_COMMAND:
                  device: powderDose
                  command: GET_GRAVIMETRICAL_MEASUREMENT
                  scope: substep # could be step or even workflow run?!

          - title: Record result
            when:
              ON_COMMAND_RESPONSE:
                device: powderDose
                command: GET_GRAVIMETRICAL_MEASUREMENT
            and: data.value >= 9 && data.value <= 11
            do:
              - SET_FIELD:
                  field: actual
                  value: data.value
              - COMPLETE_SUBSTEP
            else:
              - ALERT:
                  title: Tolerance Missed
                  text: |
                    Result is not within tolerance of 1 {{target.unit}} of the
                    target of {{target}}. Repeat the step.
              - REPEAT_STEP # note that we repeat the entire step not only substep

      - primary: |
          Results after gravimetrical placement are recorded: {{actual}}
        behaviors:
          - when: ON_SUBSTEP_START
            delay: 4s
            do:
              - COMPLETE_SUBSTEP
              - COMPLETE_STEP

      - primary: Send results to ELN
        behaviors:
          - when: ON_SUBSTEP_COMPLETE
            do:
              - webhook:
                  url: http://localhost:5000/__cypress__/webhook?status=200&body=6
                  method: post
                  blocking: false
                  headers:
                    content-type: application/json
                  body: |
                    {
                      "registered_value": "{{someString}}",
                      "description": "some information goes here"
                    }
                  onSuccess:
                    processor: json
                    do:
                      - SET_FIELD:
                          field: actual
                          value: data.value
                      - webhook:
                          url: http://localhost:5000/__cypress__/webhook?status=204
                  onError:
                    processor: json
                    do:
                      - REPEAT_SUBSTEP
                  onCode:
                    '404':
                      processor: json
                      do:
                        - ALERT:
                            title: Not Found
                            text: Ensure that you're using a valid
                              url / endpoint

                    '418':
                      processor: json
                      do:
                        - ALERT:
                            title: I'm a teapot
                            text: For real! I'm a teapot

  alert:
    info:
      title: Alert completed
    substeps:
      - primary: Ahoy, Matey!
    behaviors:
      - title: Alert that we are done.
        when: ON_STEP_START
        do:
          - ALERT:
              title: Finished!
              text: We are done here.

  buttonStep:
    info:
      title: A step with a handled button.
    substeps:
      - primary: This is a step with a button.
        buttons:
          - label: Click me
            key: clickable-button
        behaviors:
          - when:
              MANUAL:
                key: clickable-button
            do:
              - COMPLETE_SUBSTEP

flow:
  - weighing:
      fields:
        target:
          number: 100
          unit: mg
      fieldMapping:
        actualWeight: actual
        sample: sample

  - parallel:
      streamA:
        - dosing
        - dosing
      streamB:
        - stirring
  - buttonStep
  - if: 'true'
    then: alert
    else:
      - alert
      - buttonStep
  - loop:
      - weighing
      - weighing
    until: field1 > 20
  - while: 'true'
    do:
      - weighing
      - weighing
  - externalStep:
      fields:
        sample: 'MySample'
      fieldMapping:
        balance: powderDispenser

Automation download.value:
when:
  RESOURCE_OPEN:
    type: smart_view
and: |
  AND(
    resource.data.attributes.settings.filters.contains = 'workflow-template-uuid',
    AND(
      resource.data.attributes.settings.filters.types[0] = 'workflow_run',
      resource.data.attributes.settings.filters.statuses[0] = 1
    )
  )
do:
  webhook:
    url: http://localhost:5000/__cypress__/webhook?status=200&body={{resource.data.attributes.settings.filters.contains}}
    method: post
    headers:
      content-type: application/json
    body: |
      {
        "automation_id": {{automation.data.id}}
      }

tags.name: Fields
tags.description:
The `fields` parameter allows you to only fetch required information in
a query. It can be combined with other query parameters. By reducing the transferred

### Examples

- _return a single attribute:_ `devices?fields[devices]=name`
- _return multiple attributes:_ `devices?fields[devices]=name,created_at`
- _along with included resources:_ `devices?include=connector&fields[devices]=name&fields[connector]=name`

tags.name: Filtering
tags.description:
Filtering of resource's instances is available via a `filter` query
parameter. Can be combined with other query parameters.

### List of available comparison operators:

| Operator | Query Symbol |
|---|---|
| greater than ('>') | `gt` |
| greater or equal ('>=') | `ge` |
| less than ('<') | `lt` |
| less or equal ('<=') | `le` |
| equal (default) ('=') | `eq` |
| not equal ('!=') | `ne` |
| like (match at least partly) ('~*') | `lk` |
| unlike (does not match even partly) ('!~*') | `nlk` |
| match json objects ('@>') | `json` |

### Examples

- `devices?filter[devices][status]=offline`
- _can be used on both the main resource and included:_ `devices?include=tasks&filter[devices][name]=DeviceName&filter[devices][status]=offline&filter[tasks][name]=SecondTask`
- _can be used with comparison operators:_ `tasks?filter[tasks][created_at][ge]=2014-01-01`.

tags.name: Pagination
tags.description:
Pagination of resource's instances is available via a `page` query
parameter. Can be combined with other query paraters.

### Examples

- _number of pages to fetch:_ `devices?page[devices][number]=10`
- _number of records per page:_ `devices?page[devices][size]=2`
- _fetch the first page of records_ `devices?page[devices][size]=2&page[devices][first]`
- _fetch the last page of records_ `devices?page[devices][size]=2&page[devices][last]`
- _fetch the next page of records_ `devices?page[devices][size]=2&page[devices][next]`
- _fetch the previous page of records_ `devices?page[devices][size]=2&page[devices][prev]`
- _show the total number of available pages:_ `devices?page[devices][total]`

tags.name: Searching
tags.description:
Full-text search of resource's instances is available via a `search` query
parameter. Can be combined with other query parameters.

### Examples

- _search users:_ `users?search[users]=John%20engineer`
- _search samples:_ `samples?search[samples]=solution%20fr8wv3mt`
- _search devices:_ `devices?search[devices]=online`

tags.name: Sorting
tags.description:
Sorting of resource's instances is available via a `sort` query
parameter. Can be combined with other query parameters.

### Examples

- _sort in an ascending order by a given attribute:_ `devices?sort[devices]=created_at`
- _sort in a descending order by a given attribute:_ `devices?sort[devices]=-created_at`
- _accepts multiple attributes:_ `sort[devices]=-created_at,name`

tags.name: command_executions
tags.description:
A command execution is created for every command send to a device. If
the driver supports it the execution will also track confirmation and
completion or failure of the command.
